pr_title: [No ticket][RISK=NO]Account creation - Add gender Identity to demographic survey

timeline.message: Add gender Identity to demographic survey
Update enum values to match UI
UI change enum to match UI field

timeline.bodyText: Please don't return a null list if you can avoid it. Can you use Collections.emptyList()?
timeline.author: jaycarlton
jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Should we be using List, or would Set be better? I.e. does order matter? I don't think we want duplicate entries.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Should we burn the old 1 & 2 values and make new ones for MAN and WOMAN? Or are they really exact replacements?
timeline.author: jaycarlton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -54,8 +54,8 @@
 
   private static final BiMap<Gender, Short> CLIENT_TO_STORAGE_GENDER =
       ImmutableBiMap.<Gender, Short>builder()
-          .put(Gender.MALE, (short) 1)
-          .put(Gender.FEMALE, (short) 2)
+          .put(Gender.MAN, (short) 1)

replies.bodyText: Its the exact replacement, i can still have this as MALE AND FEMALE and have ui label MAN and WOMAN , but since we are going to reintroduce the table itself i thought its best that our enum matches the label
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.bodyText:
I think we should consider making it a bad request if NONE or PREFER_NO_ANSWER aren't by themselves. The UI should probably enforce that as well.
We should definitely allow combining the others though.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Since that logic is not just limited to gender we can have another PR/story to take care of it.
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.bodyText: nit: can this be a set instead of a list?
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Good point will change this to set
replies.author: NehaBroad

replies.bodyText: However this will . be consistent with other elements will it be ok if i can have another PR to have it for all the elements (race ,sexAtbirth)?
replies.author: NehaBroad
